symptoms: Central AC not cooling properly; runs continuously, house temperature stuck at 78°F (set to 72°F). Condenser running but quieter than usual. No ice. Serviced 6 months ago (refrigerant top-off). Energy bills up 30%.

root_cause_hypotheses.evidence: Previous top-off, reduced cooling, increased energy bills.

most_likely_cause: Refrigerant leak is the most likely cause, leading to reduced cooling capacity and increased energy consumption.

recommended_actions.step: Refrigerant leak test: Use electronic leak detector and bubble solution on all connections.
recommended_actions.why: Pinpoint and confirm the location of any refrigerant leaks.

recommended_actions.step: Repair leaks: Seal or replace leaking components.
Evacuate and recharge system: Follow manufacturer's specifications.
recommended_actions.why: Restore proper refrigerant charge and cooling performance.

recommended_actions.step: Monitor system pressures and temperatures: Verify proper operation after recharge.

safety_notes: Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) when handling refrigerant.
Ensure proper ventilation when working with refrigerant.
Recover refrigerant properly to prevent environmental damage.
Do not overcharge the system with refrigerant.
Depressurize system before repairing any components.
disclaimers: Cost and time estimates are approximate and may vary based on the specific leak location and parts required.
E1 is a generic error code; further diagnostics are needed for confirmation.

confidence.assessment: Insufficient data to achieve target confidence. Further diagnostics are needed to confirm the leak and compressor health.

confidence_uplift_requirements: Leak test results showing leak location

customer_readiness_check.short_reason: Confidence is below threshold; needs refrigerant pressure readings and leak test confirmation for high confidence recommendation.
